sentence.Network_en: Do I sound envious? I pity them, actually.
sentence.Network_cn: 我听起来是嫉妒吗？实际上我是可怜他们。

sentence.Network_en: I don't think I'm envious of your success.
sentence.Network_cn: 我想我并不嫉妒你的成功。

sentence.Network_en: Everyone is so envious of her.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French envieus, from envie 'envy', on the pattern of Latin invidiosus 'invidious'

entry.def: If you are envious of someone, you want something that they have.

example.ex: I don't think I'm envious of your success...
example.tran: 我想我并不嫉妒你的成功。

example.ex: Do I sound envious? I pity them, actually.
example.tran: 我听起来是嫉妒吗？实际上我是可怜他们。

means.word_mean: 1. showing extreme cupidity; painfully desirous of another's advantages;

sentences.sentence: "he was never covetous before he met her"
"jealous of his success and covetous of his possessions"

auth_sentence.content: This makes the men scared and envious of us.
auth_sentence.res_content: This makes the men scared and envious of us.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This makes the men scared and envious of us.

auth_sentence.content: The envious, frightened ones will be their husbands.
auth_sentence.res_content: The envious, frightened ones will be their husbands.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The envious, frightened ones will be their husbands.

auth_sentence.content: The envious, admiring ones will be mothers.
auth_sentence.res_content: The envious, admiring ones will be mothers.

stems_affixes.word_buile: envy[n.&v.羡慕,忌妒]+ious……的→envious妒忌的, 嫉妒的

sentences.en: Envious glances were cast at Anne.
sentences.cn: 嫉妒的目光向安妮投来。

sentences.en: Don’t tell me any more—you’re making me envious!
sentences.cn: 别再说了，你都让我羨慕死了！
